snippet: The death of Max Shatto, a Russian boy adopted by a Texas family, bolstered an international furor over the adoption of Russian children. And it devastated the couple accused of abusing him.
abstract: Death of Max Shatto, Russian boy adopted by a Texas family, bolstered international furor over adoption of Russian children, and his adoptive parents Laura and Alan Shatto say incident has left their family shattered; lingering suspicions about Max's death, despite official finding that it was an accident, have left the Shattos pariahs in their community.

byline.original: By RACHEL L. SWARNS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Rachel L. Swarns reported from Gardendale, Tex., and David M. Herszenhorn from Russia.

lead_paragraph: The death of Max Shatto, a Russian boy adopted by a Texas family, bolstered an international furor over the adoption of Russian children. And it devastated the couple accused of abusing him.

headline.main: World of Grief and Doubt After an Adoptee’s Death
